title: Liverpool tracking Pedro Obiang as boss Jurgen Klopp takes an interest in West Ham midfield star
text:
red ped Liverpool tracking Pedro Obiang as boss Jurgen Klopp takes an interest in West Ham midfield star 
Hammers ace is being watched by Klopp as he prepares for another squad overhaul at Anfield during the summer Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIVERPOOL are tracking West Ham midfielder Pedro Obiang as boss Jurgen Klopp prepares another overhaul of his squad this summer. 
Klopp is aware his current group are still short of the quality in depth needed to mount a sustained challenge for the Premier League title. PA:Press Association 5 West Ham midfielder Pedro Obiang is being tracked by Liverpool 
And with a return to the Champions League stage also a possibility he knows he has to sign at least four new players over the close season. 
Now SunSport has learnt Hammers midfielder Obiang is one of the players under consideration after catching the eye of Klopp with a series of impressive displays over the past few months. Getty Images Pedro Obiang has shone at the heart of the West Ham midfield this season Getty Images 5 Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is having Pedo Obiang watched as he looks to strengthen his squad over the summer 
The 24-year-old has emerged as one of the most influential players at the Olympic Stadium this season in his role at the base of the team’s midfield. 
When West Ham were struggling near the foot of the Premier League, the former Sampdoria player was one of the few to be impressing. 
And he has been one of the main driving forces in the club’s climb away from relegation trouble to mid-table safety over the past six weeks. 
His displays have not gone un-noticed at Anfield where scouts have alerted Klopp to his value as a deep lying midfielder – an area Liverpool are looking to strengthen over the summer. Getty Images Obiang scores from long range as West Ham beat Southampton in the Premier League Richard Pelham Pedro Obiang has emerged as a key player at West Ham at the base of their midfield Southampton 1-3 West Ham : Hammers bounce back to beat Saints at St Mary's 
Klopp himself has been impressed by the Spaniard's form this season and will continue to monitor his progress over the coming weeks, before deciding whether to follow up the interest with a bid. 
Obiang will have two years left on his existing deal with the Hammers at the end of the season and is settled with life at the club, so Liverpool would have to find around £18million to get a deal done.
